key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs undercut EY.com on 21% of itineraries last week, up 8 pts WoW, with UAE-origin routes hit hardest at 40% undercut frequency.
Meta-search engines priced every observed EY fare lower than the website (-0.10% average gap), indicating 100% leakage and zero parity.
GDS retains 88.5% parity; only 1.6% lower fares but 9.9% higher fares—risk concentrated in UAE-origin and close-in bookings.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs priced below EY.com in 21% of itineraries last week, +8 pts WoW and +10 pts MoM.
Overall parity fell to 76.6%, down 4.8 pts WoW and 8.2 pts MoM.
UAE-origin routes see OTA undercuts 40% of the time—13× higher than non-UAE markets.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fare missing on OTAs only 1% of the time, unchanged vs prior periods.
'Same' fares still 76.6% but slipping (-5 pts WoW).
Undercuts now 21.4%; average gap modest (-2%) but frequency escalating.
OTA premiums rare at 1%; when present, average +19%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul matches network: parity 76.6%, undercuts 21.4% (+8 pts WoW).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity only 57.9%; undercuts surge to 40% (+12.8 pts WoW).
Parity strong at 94.8%; undercuts minimal at 3.1%.

mse_highlights.line_content: All observed fares cheaper on MSE than EY.com last week—no parity or premiums.
Average price gap only ‑0.10%, but universality signals systemic leakage.
Lower-price share up 1.6 pts WoW and 1.1 pts MoM; 'Same' cases have vanished.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No missing EY fares on MSE across all periods.
Parity dropped to 0%, down from 0.5% last month.
100% of itineraries cheaper on MSE (-0.10%); frequency +1.6 pts WoW.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE undercut EY.com on every short-haul route last week (-0.10% gap).

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Lower pricing 100%; gap ‑0.10%, frequency +2.5 pts WoW.
Lower pricing sustained at 100%; gap steady at ‑0.09%.

gds_highlights.line_content: 88.5% of GDS fares matched EY.com last week, steady WoW.
9.9% of fares higher on GDS (avg +4%); incidence down 0.7 pts WoW.
Premium cases spike to 19.2% for UAE-origin and 10% for close-in bookings.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No 'website fare not found' cases on GDS.
88.5% parity last week (+0.2 pts WoW; ‑2.8 pts MoM).
GDS undercuts rare at 1.6%, but share has tripled vs last month.
